intro: Sisymbrium cardinalis-tedeschinii, commonly known as the desert mustards, is an annual flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which is characterized by its small, cross-shaped flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves and deep root systems to conserve water. It produces yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in rocky or sandy habitats.
